STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 20, 2020
Jacquelyn Marry
Fostering Solutions
Suite A
131 S. Winter Street
Adrian, MI 49221
RE: License #: CB460360419
Fostering Solutions
Suite A
131 S. Winter Street
Adrian, MI 49221
Dear Mrs. Marry:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on (date). Due
to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Settlement Agreement (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is required.
It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and
your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
Three of three adoption evaluations were not completed within the required
timeframe:
File 1: Application dated 1/29/19, initial adoption evaluation completed 5/20/19.
File 2: Application dated 4/19/19, initial adoption evaluation completed 9/13/19.
File 3: Application dated 1/22/19, initial adoption evaluation completed 10/11/19.
Technical Assistance: The agency reported that they believed the 90 day
requirement was only for families that are matched with a child, as is the
requirement in MDHHS Policy 605 (1). Technical Assistance was provided to the
agency that licensing rules require all adoption evaluations within 90 days of
application
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.3 Supervisory Oversight
Page 27
Supervisors shall meet at least monthly with each assigned
worker to review the status and progress of each case on the
worker’s caseload.
One of eight case files was missing a monthly supervision contact for November
2019.
4

3.) Any Violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-06b Family Team Meetings
Page 3
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as outlined in
the following tables:
Case Plan Reassessment (USP)- Within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
One of eight case files had a USP dated 8/15/19, which did not have an FTM
completed at least 30 days prior.
FOM 722-08c Required Participation in Development
Page 2
The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required and
indicates that the foster parent/caregiver acknowledges and
agrees to the activities required to meet the needs of the child in
their care.
Parents and youths age 14 and older must sign the PATP.
Two of eight files did not meet this requirement.
File 1: The 5/17/19 PATP was missing the father and foster parent’s signatures.
File 2: The 8/9/19 PATP was missing the youth signature.
IV. FIELD ANALYST SAFETY ALERTS
No safety concerns were identified by the field analyst during this review.
V. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
Rule 605- Adoption evaluations. TA was provided as noted under the rule violation.
VI. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
5

Relative referrals- The agency asked for clarification regarding the new processes
for relative referrals. An inquiry has been made regarding the new DHHS policy. The
agency will be provided with clarification once it is received by DCWL.
Informed Consent for Psychotropic Medication- The agency requested consultation
regarding the process of providing the consent form to the Foster Care Psychotropic
Medication Oversight Unit.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
One CAP was submitted and approved on 12/11/2018, as a result of the 11/27/2018
renewal evaluation. The agency had violations in the following areas: medical
passports, semi-annual transition meetings, timely entry of caseworker contacts, and
timely supervisory approval of service plans.
The second CAP was submitted and approved on 1/10/2018, as a result of the
12/19/17 interim evaluation. The agency had violations in the following areas:
placement change documentation, timely entry of caseworker contacts, and medical
passports.
No repeat violations were found during this review. The agency continues to follow
their CAPs and shows strengths in many areas.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, ISEP requirements, or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
January 13, 2020
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
6

Approved By:
January 17, 2020
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
